Description: Bowl of Nile silt pottery with flat base and flaring walls, coated on the interior with red slip, burnished, and decorated in white pigment with cross-hatched triangles depending from the rim to the tondo, with upward pointing cross-hatched triangular motifs between them. The exterior is unslipped and loosely burnished
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (pl. xxxii.1a; xxxiv.28)
Condition: fair, salt damage to exterior and base; interior worn.
